items.title: Nuxt 3.0, TypeScript 4.9, Angular 15..
items.content:
#â€‹615 â€” November 18, 2022

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Whatâ€™s So Great About Functional Programming? â€” If anyone has excitedly insisted you check out Elm, PureScript, Haskell or F#, they may have caught Functionitisâ„¢ and want you to catch it too. James, author of the forthcoming Skepticâ€™s Guide to Functional Programming with JavaScript, sells the ideas behind functional programming here in a way we can all grok. â€œItâ€™s all about confidence.â€

James Sinclair

Deno 1.28 Released with (Better) npm Compatibility â€” Most of us are attached to the npm ecosystem and packages, so itâ€™s great to see alternative runtime Deno making it easier to use them with no node_modules, package.json or npm install in sight.

The Deno Team

ğŸ’¡ Deno is worth a fresh look, if only for how itâ€™s brought so many tools into one easy place â€“ see this Node to Deno cheatsheet forÂ examples.

ğŸ§ˆ Retire Your Legacy CMS with ButterCMS â€” ButterCMS is your new content backend. Weâ€™re SaaS so we host, maintain, and scale the CMS. Enable your marketing team to update website + app content without needing you. Try the #1 rated SaaS Headless CMS for your JS app today. Free for 30Â days.

ğŸ§ˆ ButterCMS sponsor

Angular v15 Released â€” It may not be the newest shiny thing, but Angular is dependable, widely used, and well maintainted. In v15, its legacy compiler is gone, standalone APIs (no NgModules!) are a stable mainstream feature, and the directive composition API opens up new code reuse strategies. Itâ€™s all on displayÂ here.

Minko Gechev

Nuxt 3.0: The Vue.js-Based WebappÂ Framework â€” Two years in the making, 3.0 is a rewrite based on Vite, Vue 3, and Nitro (the server engine) with first-class TypeScript support. If Vue is your thing, this may be the full stack option forÂ you.

Pooya Parsa

Announcing TypeScript 4.9 â€” The latest version of the popular typed JavaScript superset and associated tooling gains the satisfies operator for matching types without losing them, auto-accessors in classes, a change to how NaN equality checks are done, plus editor tooling and perfÂ improvements.

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

IN BRIEF:

  • Narwhal, the company behind the Nx monorepo-oriented build system, has raised $8.6m in seed funding. You're gunna need a bigger monorepo.

  • CORRECTION: Apologies to Netlify for us crediting their Jamstack survey results to Vercel last week. Thanks to Cassidy Williams (& others) for letting us know. Unlike with Shopify vs Spotify, we have no excuseÂ ğŸ˜

  • We're loving these two new fonts from GitHub. Open licensed, variable features, and a snazzy landing page, too.

RELEASES:

  • Playwright 1.28
    â†³ Web automation & browser control.

  • Cypress 11.1
    â†³ Fast, easy and reliable testing. Now supports Next 13.

  • ğŸ§¹ NPKILL 0.10 â€“ node_modules tidier.

  • Derby 1.1 â€“ Full-stack MVC app framework.

  • Node.js 19.1.0

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

The Magical World of Particles with React Three Fiber and Shaders â€” You'll learn a lot about shaders and rendering particle effects in this fascinating interactiveÂ primer.

Maxime Heckel

ECMAScript Proposal: RegExp's /v Flag â€” A proposed new regular expression flag /v would improve support for multi-codepoint graphemes (like some emojis) in character classes, allow the nesting and combination of character classes, and improve case-insensitive matching for negated classes. Itâ€™s complicated but Axel boils itÂ down.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Quokka.js - The Fastest Way to Learn JavaScript / TypeScript â€” WithÂ 2M+ downloads, Quokka.js is the #1 tool for exploring and testing JavaScript/TypeScript. Vite support is comingÂ soon.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Styling Form States Without JS â€” You can get a long way with the :has pseudo class and itâ€™s semi-wellÂ supported.

Jen Simmons

â–¶Â Â A Crash Course for GitHub Codespaces â€” Building a simple Node app. (40Â minutes.)

Hitesh Choudhary

Component Driven Development with Storybook andÂ Nightwatch
Andrei Rusu

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

tslog 4.0: Expressive Logging with TypeScript Support â€” Feature packed, fully typed, can do stack traces via the native V8 API, show code frames, and more. Now supports both Node and theÂ browser.

Eugene Terehov

TanStack Router: A Fully Type-Safe Router â€” Powerful routing and first-class search-param APIs for React, Solid, Vue and Svelte. Built in caching, auto prefetching, andÂ more.

Tanner Linsley

Zigi: Your Automated Workflow Assistant for All Things Non-Code

Zigi sponsor

Wireit: Upgrades Your npm Scripts to Make Them Smarter and MoreÂ Efficient â€” A library that extends npm/pnpm/yarn to make existing scripts more efficient and support things like parallelism, cascades, and result caching (essentially memoization for npmÂ run!)

Google

AEWC: Web Component to Add the Ace Code Editor to a Page â€” Ace is a mature code editor control and this wraps it up in Web ComponentÂ form.

Marketing Pipeline

Twix: Style React Components with Tailwind CSS â€” If you never liked having CSS in your JavaScript, how about TailwindÂ instead?

Kasper Mikiewicz

OverlayScrollbars 2.0: JS Scrollbar Plugin to Replace Native Scrollbars â€” Provides custom styleable overlay scrollbars while keeping a native functionality and feel. Use judiciously. v2.0 is a full rewrite in TypeScript and smaller, too.

Rene Haas

Build Frictionless, Secure, High-Converting Onboarding Flows â€” The all-in-one developer platform for auth. Launch a login flow in minutes using our API and SDKs. Start buildingÂ today.

Stytch sponsor

  • <qr-code> 1.1
    â†³ Web Component for generating QR codes. (Demo.)

  • FortuneSheet 0.9
    â†³ Drop-in Excel-like spreadsheet component. (Demo.)

  • Happy DOM 7.7
    â†³ JS implementation of a browser sans GUI.

  • Capacitor 4.5
    â†³ X-platform native PWA app API and toolkit.

  • vue-concurrency 4.0
    â†³ Concurrency management for Vue and Composition API.

  • <relative-time> 3.3 â€” Extensions to <time>

  • DOCX 7.7 â€“ Generate .docx files.

  • React95 4.0 â€“ Win95-style React components.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineer â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Stickermule

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“ŸÂ Where are my Turbo Pascal, QBasic, or Turbo C++ folks at?

DOjS: A DOS JavaScript Canvas withÂ Sound â€” This interesting project truly stands on the shoulders of many others. If you ever coded for DOS, you will find this impressive. +1 point for the projectâ€™sÂ name.

SuperIlu

items.title: Rome wasn't rewritten in a day
items.content:
#â€‹614 â€” November 11, 2022

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Rome v10: Rust-Powered JS Linting and Formatting â€” A project founded by the original creator of Babel naturally provokes interest. Romeâ€™s ambitious mission is to unify all the frontend dev tools youâ€™d need into one, and formatting and linting is where theyâ€™ve started with this curiously numbered release. Shouldn't it should be RomeÂ X?Â ğŸ˜

The Rome Team

Editorial note: "Oh no, another tool!" I hear you cry. Despite its youth, Rome already has some compelling points in its favor, including rich diagnostics that not only drill into what is wrong with your code, but why it's wrong. It will be fantastic to see this sort of tooling advance further.

A Complete TypeScript Learning Path â€” Many teams are introducing types to their Web and Node.js apps with TypeScript. Over four courses going from the fundamentals through to production, let Mike North bring you up to speed with TypeScript's power and capabilities for writing more robustÂ code.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Why Would Anyone Need Generator Functions? â€” You can go a long time without feeling the need for generators. So, you may wonder, what are they good for? While they may not be essential, they do have utility and can change how you approach certain problems. James cracks out the chocolate biscuits toÂ explain.

James Sinclair

Gatsby 5.0: The Fastest Gatsby Yet â€” The performance oriented React-based framework (that isnâ€™t Next.js) takes a leap forward with the Slice API for speeding up common updates across a site, partial hydration (beta), a new Script component for loading scripts, incremental builds and deploys, and more. This release follows Gatsbyâ€™s fresh pitch as a â€˜reactive siteÂ generatorâ€™.

Josh Johnson (Gatsby Team)

IN BRIEF:

  • Get ready to spruce up your READMEs with GitHub Blocks: dynamic components you'll be able to add to your README to include demos, live stats, search features, comparison tables, etc.

  • Overwhelmed by the constant influx of new frameworks? It's a good thing, concluded a panel of framework creators at Jamstack Conf this week.

  • The results from Vercel's Netlify's (thanks to Cassidy Williams for the correction!) Jamstack Community Survey 2022 are out. Serverless, React, and Next.js all saw huge popularity. (â†’ Via JAMstacked)

  • A look at the state of IPFS in relation to JavaScript. (IPFS is a large distributed peer-to-peer storage system and protocol.)

RELEASES:

  • Parcel 2.8
    â†³ Zero-config build tool. Quite a big release with a brand new bundling algorithm and improved automatic code splitting.

  • Node.js 19.0.1, 18.12.1, 16.18.1 and 14.21.1

  • Hapi 21 â€“ 'Batteries included' Node framework.

  • pnpm 7.15 â€“ Fast, space efficient package manager.

ğŸ“…Â Register for Unblock 2022 - A CI/CD Conference by Buildkite

Buildkite sponsor

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

The Temporal API: JavaScript Dates, but Better â€” Working with dates in JavaScript is clunky enough for there to be a whole ecosystem of libraries to make it easier (e.g. Moment.js) but Temporal is a (stage 3) proposal to bring a modern date/time API intoÂ play.

Vlad Mihet

Creating 'Fluffy Trees' with Three.js â€” If you want to make something very pretty with JavaScript and GLSL shaders thisÂ weekend.

Michael Dougall

Node.js Security Best Practices â€” A new official document from the Node.js team providing guidelines on securing your Node apps by looking at what the main threats are and how to mitigateÂ them.

Node.js Project

â–¶Â Â A Podcast for Candid Chats on Product, Business & Leadership â€” Join Postlight leaders & guests as they discuss topics like running great meetings & creating solid productÂ launches.

The Postlight Podcast sponsorpodcast

Migrating from Monaco Editor to CodeMirror â€” The folks at Sourcegraph share what they gained in switching their in-browser code editor to what could arguably be considered a less modernÂ option.

Kling and Dorfman

A Love Letter to React (from the Creator ofÂ Phoenix) â€” A warm-hearted enumeration of Reactâ€™s positive qualities from the folks at Fly.io. An interesting angle is the author is the creator of Elixirâ€™s Phoenix framework which itself borrows ideas fromÂ React.

Chris McCord (Fly.io)

How to Dedupe 28 Million Strings with JavaScript? â€” Fun question (and answers) on Stack Overflow. This task isnâ€™t exactly a great fit for either JavaScript or its runtimes, but thereâ€™s always aÂ way.

Stack Overflow

âš ï¸Â â–¶ï¸ A Next.js 13 Warning: An Easy Infinite Loop Mistake â€” Jack explains thisÂ well.
Jack Herrington

Using TypeScript with Node.js
Robin Wieruch

Using Web Components with Next (or Any SSR Framework)
Adam Rackis

Exploring Bunâ€™s Built-In React Boilerplate
Mayank Choubey

Mocking a Class with Jest: Two Ways to Make It Easier
Geshan Manandhar

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Trix 2.0: A Rich WYSIWYG Editor for the Web â€” A WYSIWYG editor developed by the folks at 37signals (known as the birthplace of Ruby on Rails). Itâ€™s used in Basecamp so is about as stress tested as you can get. GitHubÂ repo.

Basecamp

Riot.js 7.1: A Simple and Elegant Component-Based UI Library â€” An interesting alternative UI library that might click with you. Itâ€™s designed to offer you â€œeverything you wished" the native web components API looked like. GitHubÂ repo.

Riot.js

Integrate a Scheduling Widget to Your App in Less Than a Day â€” Extensive API offering a high level of customization. Seamless integration into React, Angular, Vue, or vanilla JSÂ apps.

Bryntum sponsor

React Calendar 4.0: The 'Ultimate' Calendar for Your React App â€” A popular, simple-styled calendar component for React apps, focused mostly on letting users pick dates. Note that youâ€™ll need to be on React 16.8+ to use v4.0 though. GitHubÂ repo.

Wojciech Maj

safe-json-value 1.9: For When JSON Serialization Should Never Fail â€” Prevents JSON.serialize() from throwing an exeception, changing types, or otherwise transforming values unexpectedly, because sometimes you need that sort ofÂ reassurance.

ehmicky

Rockpack 3.0: An Alternative React AppÂ Builder â€” Like Create React App Rockpack's goal is to keep project setup time low, but it holds some different opinions around how far to go and packs in many ideas like server side rendering and, now, linting.

Alex Sergey

  • WaveSurfer.js 6.4
    â†³ Navigable waveforms atop Web Audio & Canvas.Â (Demos.)

  • Kosko 3.0
    â†³ Organize Kubernetes manifests in JavaScript.

  • Marked 4.2.2
    â†³ Perf-focused Markdown parser and compiler.Â (Demo.)

  • React Bootstrap 2.6 â€” Bootstrap 5 components for React.

  • React Tooltip 4.5 â€“ A tooltip component, surprisingly.Â (Demo.)

  • Strapi 4.5 â€“ Popular Node-based headless CMS.

  • Nest.js 9.2 â€“ Server-side Node.js framework.

ğŸ’» Jobs

UX Engineer â€” Stimulus is a social platform started by Sticker Mule to show what's possible if your mission is to increase human happiness. Join our engineeringÂ team.
Stimulus

Senior JavaScript/TypeScript Developer (Remote or Warsaw) ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± â€” Take the next step in your career and help us migrate CKEditor 5 to TypeScript! Develop the software used by millions of usersÂ ğŸŒ
CKEDITOR

Senior Frontend Engineer (San Francisco) â€” Build interfaces for an AI-powered research assistant that makes knowledge workers smarter. TypeScript, React,Â GraphQL.
Heyday

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

UX Engineer â€” Stimulus is a social platform started by Sticker Mule to show what's possible if your mission is to increase human happiness. Join our engineeringÂ team.
  
Stimulus 
  


  
Senior JavaScript/TypeScript Developer (Remote or Warsaw) ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± â€” Take the next step in your career and help us migrate CKEditor 5 to TypeScript! Develop the software used by millions of usersÂ ğŸŒ
  
CKEDITOR 
  


  
Senior Frontend Engineer (San Francisco) â€” Build interfaces for an AI-powered research assistant that makes knowledge workers smarter. TypeScript, React,Â GraphQL.
  
Heyday 
  


  
Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
  
Hired

items.title: Is Turbopack really 10x faster than Vite?
items.content:
#â€‹613 â€” November 4, 2022

Read on the Web
Together withÂ 

JavaScript Weekly

What Is a 'Realm' in JavaScript? â€” One of those things you donâ€™t need to know, but that will flesh out your understanding of JS under the hood. A realm is essentially the complete execution environment for a JavaScriptÂ program.

Gal Weizman

Then if you really want to go down the rabbit hole, enter the ShadowRealm with Dr.Â Axel..

Is Turbopack Really 10x Faster Than Vite? â€” Last weekâ€™s big news was the unveiling of Turbopack, a Rust-based â€˜successorâ€™ to Webpack that boasts significantly performance improvements. Vue and Viteâ€™s Evan You decided to run some benchmarks and ended up pretty deep down the rabbitÂ hole.

Evan You

Open-Source Firebase Alternative for Web, Mobile & Flutter Devs â€” Appwrite is a secure, self-hosted solution that provides developers with a set of easy-to-use REST APIs to manage their core backend needs. You can build anything with Appwrite! Click here to learnÂ more.

Appwrite sponsor

Shopify Acquires the Remix Project â€” A mere year after being open sourced, Remix, an exciting full stack Web framework and its associated company, has been acquired by e-commerce giant Shopify. Dion (truly a huge name in the JS space in the day) explains why here, but if youâ€™d prefer a â–¶ï¸ snappy two-minute overview then Fireship has youÂ covered.

Dion Almaer (Shopify)

Announcing TypeScript 4.9 RC â€” A long awaited release gets a big step closer. satisfies is introduced to validate that the type of an expression matches some type without changing the actual resulting type. There are also auto-accessors in classes (an upcoming feature in ES itself) and editor enhancements such as â€œRemove Unused Importsâ€ and â€œSort Importsâ€. 4.9 final is expected in twoÂ weeks.

Daniel Rosenwasser

IN BRIEF:

  • React Native has switched its default new app template from using Flow toÂ TypeScript.

  • ğŸ„ A group of Vue developers are running âœ‰ï¸Â Advent of Vue, an email-delivered set of festively-themed coding puzzles built around building Vue components. Think Advent of Code but more Vue-y!

  • Key security releases of Node.js are expected imminently (later today!)

  • The Component Gallery is a handy index of components.

  • The Svelte team shares an update on the state of Svelte as of November 2022.

RELEASES:

  • Redux Toolkit 1.9 â€“ Official toolset for Redux.

  • Foal 3.0
    â†³ Full-featured Node.js webapp framework.

  • Vuetify 3.0
    â†³ Material component framework for Vue.

  • Ember 4.8.1, 4.4.4, 3.28.10 & 3.24.7
    â†³ Security releases of the framework.

  • VS Code â€“ October 2022 edition

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

How to Build, Test, and Publish a TypeScript npm Package in 2022 â€” The bare basic steps in a short and sweetÂ walkthrough.

Ianis Triandafilov

'Your Next.js Bundle Will Thank You' â€” If your Next.js app bundle sizes are bigger than youâ€™d like, Renatoâ€™s advice is forÂ you.

Renato Pozzi

Creating Human-Readable Date/Time Differences â€” There are libraries to get your â€œ2 minutes agoâ€, â€œ5 months agoâ€ or â€œ1 year agoâ€ but did you know the Intl API can do it too? Intl.RelativeTimeFormat() is there and supports numerousÂ languages. GitHub's relative-time is an alternative if you need a littleÂ extra.

Amit Merchant

Build a Mobile-Responsive Telehealth Pager App Using Streamâ€™s ChatÂ API â€” Build a responsive chat app with emojis/reactions, built-in GIF support, ability to edit/delete messages, direct & group chat, andÂ more.

Stream sponsor

Code Coverage with Storybook Test Runner â€” Coverage reports can show you how much of your code is actually reached in testing and help you find untested areas. Storybook's test runner now generates coverage reports to help with this and supports React, Preact, Svelte and Vue out of theÂ box.

Yann Braga (Storybook)

How to Package and Distribute a Vue.js 3 Plugin on npm â€” Uses Vite to build things and vue-tsc to generate types for optimalÂ DX.

Daniel Kelly

Building an Accessible Tooltip Component â€” A well structured overview of how to build a color-adaptive and accessible <tool-tip> custom element. Thereâ€™s a â–¶ï¸ video version of this post if youâ€™d prefer too. The JavaScript isÂ minimal.

Adam Argyle

â–¶Â Â Creating a Minecraft Clone with React and Three.js â€” (91Â minutes.)
Daniel Berk

Running JavaScript in WebAssembly with WasmEdge â€” Why? WhyÂ not!
Second State

An Overview of JavaScript Promises
Sandeep Panda & James Hibbard beginner

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Vuestic UI 1.5: A UI Library for VueÂ 3 â€” A library of sixty customizable components. v1.5 is a big release boasting significantly improved accessibility, new tree, split view, dropdown and virtual scroll components, dark theming, and more. OfficialÂ homepage.

Epicmax

Joi 17.7: Object Schema and DataÂ Validations â€” Describe your data using a simple, fluent API and Joi can check if data you supply to it is up to scratch, e.g. Joi.string().min(3).max(30)

Sideway Inc.

Radar SDKs and APIs: Fastest Way to a Wide-Range of Location-Based Experiences â€” Flexible and affordable geocoding, search, and distance APIs with high-quality address and place data. Sign upÂ today.

Radar sponsor

directory-serve: Serve a Local Directory Over HTTP, Quickly â€” This is neat. If you have Node and npm installed, run npx directory-serve . to get an HTTP server serving up the currentÂ directory.

Cube-Root

relative-time: An Element to Format a Timestamp as a Localized RelativeÂ Time â€” Supply this web component with a standard formatted date and time and itâ€™ll render the right text toÂ suit.

GitHub

Pinceau: A CSS-in-TypeScript Framework Built for Vue â€” Still early days but has the perk of seamless integration into Vue, and works with Nuxt, Vitesse, and Vite.

YaÃ«l Guilloux

Markdoc 0.2: A Flexible, Markdown-Based AuthoringÂ Framework â€” An extension of Markdown but with extra features ideal for blog posts or docs. Itâ€™s used for Stripeâ€™s public docs, but you can bring it into your own systems. GitHubÂ repo.

Stripe

Shortcut Brings Product and Engineering Together. Try It for Free

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

  • jest-image-snapshot 6.0
    â†³ Matcher for visual comparisons/regressions.

  • Sigma.js 2.4
    â†³ High-perf rendering of complex graphs.

  • Docusaurus 2.2
    â†³ Facebook's documentation web site builder.

  • Taxi 1.2
    â†³ Small library for PJAX navigation and animations to sites.

  • Jasmine 4.5 â€“ Testing framework for browsers & Node.

  • Chartist.js 1.3 â€“ Simple responsive charts. Not the 1800s political movement.

  • Forge 6.0 â€“ Tool to build/publish Electron apps.

  • React Toastify 9.1 â€“ On-screen notifications made easy.

  • vanilla-tilt.js 1.7.3 â€“ Smooth 3D tilting.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior JavaScript/TypeScript Developer (Remote or Warsaw) â€” CKEditor is migrating to TypeScript, will you migrate your talent to the CKEditor team? ğŸ§³ Join us and realize your trueÂ potential.
CKEditor

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“—Â We're also reading..

We've also had some tabs open that aren't JavaScript specific but you might find interesting anyway:

Comparing TCP and QUIC by Geoff Huston. If HTTP/3, QUIC and UDP are buzzwords for you and you want to know what's going on under the hood, this is a good technical primer (HTTP/3 is basically HTTP mapped on top of QUIC, as opposed to HTTP 1 and HTTP/2 which use TCP).

Advice That Actually Worked For Me by Nabeel Qureshi. A bit more thoughtful and universal than most advice posts.

A Visual Studio 6.0 Nostalgia Trip by Wouter Groeneveld. I might be showing my age by enjoying this. Next stop.. Delphi! Or QBasic..?

items.title: Turbo-charged incremental bundling au Rust
items.content:
#â€‹612 â€” October 28, 2022

Read on the Web
Together withÂ 

JavaScript Weekly

Turbopack: A Rust-Based 'Successor' to Webpack â€” With over 3 billion downloads, webpack is currently the undisputed champion of the bundlers (though Vite has been rapidly advancing upon it). Vercel found it too slow so has funded work on Turbopack, powered by Rust (a synonym for â€˜fasterâ€™ in some circles nowadays.. ğŸ˜) It's a project to keep an eye on (especially if you're a Next.js user) and boasts significant performance boosts over webpack and even Vite, but there are some limitations to take into account:

  • It's arguable if it's a "successor" to webpack, as Turbopack can't do much of what Webpack can yet, and while they share a creator, webpack is an active project with maintainers of its own.
  • It's very connected to React and Next.js 13 (also released this week â€“ more on that next) â€“ Vue and Svelte support is to follow.
  • The similarly Rust-powered SWC is used to transpile JS/TS.
  • Vite's Evan You ğŸ¦ casts some doubt on the perf differenceÂ claims. He also has ğŸ¦ a thread with his thoughts on TurbopackÂ generally.
  • In short, unless you are living on the Next.js edge, stick with webpack or Vite for now.

Koppers and Palmer (Vercel)

Implement JavaScript Developer Solutions for Every Project â€” Get dependency-free, fast, flexible, true JavaScript components that enable you to build basic websites, full enterprise applications, Excel-like spreadsheet tools, and reports for your organization. Empower your JavaScript developersÂ today.

GrapeCity sponsor

Node 18 Becomes Active LTS with v18.12.0 â€” Formerly a â€˜currentâ€™ release getting all the newest features, version 18 is now the active â€˜Long Term Supportâ€™ release and will remain so until October 2023. Its codename is Hydrogen â€“ quite fitting as the most abundant element in theÂ universe.

Ruy Adorno and Rafael Gonzaga

If you're using an older LTS version and are wondering what Node 18 has to offer, Marian Villa presents 11 Features in Node.js 18 you need to try, including the fetch API, --watch, and the native Node test runner.

IN BRIEF:

  • The SQLite project now has official WASM/JS documentation relating to SQLite's presence in WebAssembly and browser contexts. sql.js has long been the go-to project in this space, but things are heating up.

  • CodePen is a perfect place to play with Preact (the smaller alternative to React) â€“ and Chris Coyier explains how.

  • Christian Heilmann reminds us that JSON.stringify can create nicely formatted, filtered, multi-line output strings.

Next.js 13 Unveiled at Next.js Conf â€” Next.js Conf 22 took place earlier this week and as well as Turborepo (above), Vercel unveiled the latest version of the site framework that has become 'inextricably linked' to React. It gains:

  • Support for an app/ directory to improve routing, layouts, and Server Components support â€“ can coexist with existing approaches.
  • A new image component with on-demand optimization and the ability to display images without layout shift.
  • A brand new font system.

Vercel

"Next.js is the framework for the web the way k8s is the framework for infrastructure" â€“ Kelsey Hightower at Next.js Conf.

JetBrains JavaScript Day 2022: An Event You Wonâ€™t Want toÂ Miss â€” Join JetBrains JavaScript Day 2022 to catch up on the latest trends and connect with other like-mindedÂ professionals.

JetBrains sponsor

RELEASES:

  • Babel 7.20.0
    â†³ The popular transpiler now supports TypeScript 4.9 and Deno as a compilation target.

  • Handsontable 12.2 â€“ Popular spreadsheet-y data grid.

  • Deno 1.27 â€“ JS server-side runtime that isn't Node. (Or Bun.)

  • Qwik 0.12 â€“ HTML-first framework.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Which Serverless Edge Platform Has the Fastest Git Deployments? â€” The team behind Deno have tested some popular serverless edge computing providers (including their own Deno Deploy) to see which has the fastest git deploymentÂ time. As always with benchmarks, read the results with a cynical eye and repeat forÂ yourself.

Andy Jiang (Deno)

How We Improved React Loading Times by 70% with Next.js â€” By replacing Create React App with Next.js, business planning platform Causal significantly improved their user experience by reducing load times. How? Well, just a little SSR can get you a longÂ way.

Causal Engineers

How to Build a Blog with Fresh and Deno â€” In other Deno news, if youâ€™ve felt like giving Deno a go for something but been unsure as to what, how about spinning up a simple blog atop the Fresh Web framework? Then deploy it really quickly to Deno Deploy ;-)

Andy Jiang (Deno)

The Fastest Way to Learn JavaScript / TypeScript â€” With 2M+ downloads world-wide, Quokka.js is the #1 tool for exploring and testing JavaScript/TypeScript without leaving yourÂ editor.

Wallaby.js sponsor

How to Write Your First Unit Test in JavaScript â€” If youâ€™re a prolific tester, scroll on. If not, this is a very lightÂ primer.

Chip Verek

â–¶Â Â A Next.js Crash Course â€” There are a lot of such videos, but this is a well recorded and up to date one so it might help you get the lay of the Next.js land (which seems to be all the rage this week in particular) if youâ€™re just starting out with it. (2 hours 30Â minutes)

Anson Foong

Detect a System Theme Preference Change from JS â€” window.matchMedia and addEventListener to theÂ rescue.

David Walsh

Advancements in Angular 14.2's Router
Andrew Scott

Using Cloudinary's Image APIs from Alpine.js
Raymond Camden

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

npoint: Simple JSON Storage Bins with Schema Validation â€” You can use this as a lightweight backend as you prototype an app/site or play with a new library. You can even let other people make changes to the data, if youÂ wish.

Alex Zirbel

Satori: Convert HTML and CSS to SVG â€” React and JSX are the preferred route in to this, but itâ€™ll work withoutÂ those. It powers Vercel's new 'social card' image generation feature.

Vercel

Donâ€™t DIY Your Notifications: Send SMS, Email, and Push withÂ OneÂ Call

Courier.com sponsor

Downshift 7.0: Primitives to Build Accessible ReactÂ Components â€” You get hooks that provide the stateful logic needed to create autocomplete, combo-box and â€˜selectâ€™ dropdown components which you can then lean on for WAI-ARIA compliantÂ goodness.

PayPal

ğŸ‰ Â Canvas Confetti: An On-Demand Confetti Shower â€” Ready to let off some fireworks in your browser? Do it in style with confetti. Plenty of demos to check out. GitHubÂ repo.

Kiril Vatev

  • NPKILL 0.9
    â†³ Lists node_modules directories and lets you clean them up.

  • Wild Wild Path 3.3
    â†³ Object property paths with wildcards and regexps.

  • capture-website 3.2
    â†³ Capture screenshots of websites with Puppeteer.

  • Mongoose 6.7
    â†³ MongoDB object modeling library for Node.js.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Become a Senior JS/TS Developer for a Leading Rich Text Editor â€” Take the next step in your career and help us migrate CKEditor 5 to TypeScript. Develop the software used by millions of usersÂ ğŸŒ
CKEditor

Software Engineer â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Stickermule

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

Software Engineer (Security) â€” Join our "kick ass" team. Our software team operates from 17 countries and we're looking for more exceptional engineers to join our SecurityÂ team.
Sticker Mule

ğŸ‘» And just in time for Halloween..

Creepyface: Makes Images of Faces 'Follow' the Pointer â€” This is an effect weâ€™ve seen mostly on â€˜about usâ€™ pages where faces of team members follow your pointer around. If you want to recreate that, here you go.. and in a timely Halloween edition too. (React user? There's a component forÂ that.)

Alejandro TardÃ­n
